results.body: After striking the umpire’s chair during an outburst at a tournament in Mexico, Alexander Zverev can avoid a fine and suspension if he does not commit further violations for one year.
results.title: Zverev’s Swings Merited More Than a Slap on the Wrist

results.body: Once a destination for international jet-setters, Acapulco has been plagued by violence in recent years, though it remains popular with Mexican tourists.
results.title: House Hunting in Mexico: A Modern Hillside Masterpiece in Acapulco
A large earthquake near Acapulco shakes Mexico’s capital.

results.body: The federal and state police, backed by the army, took over security in the resort city, where the local force is suspected to have been infiltrated by organized crime.
results.title: Mexican Authorities Disarm Acapulco Police Amid Corruption Inquiry

results.body: Tourist areas like Cancún and Los Cabos have seen an increased police presence following shooting incidents. The United States issued an updated warning last month.
results.title: After New Travel Warning, Questions About Safety in Mexico

results.body: A clash among rival gangs in Acapulco on Thursday added to Mexico’s soaring homicide count. The country is on pace for its deadliest year in recent history.
results.title: 28 Dead and 3 Wounded After Brawl at Mexican Prison

results.body: With quiet, haunting images, Yael Martínez has explored how Mexico’s drug-fueled violence has shattered his family’s emotional and psychological well-being.
results.title: A Family’s Loss, Mexico’s Tragedy

results.body: The bodies of 60 men, women and children have been found piled in an abandoned crematorium in Acapulco, the authorities in Guerrero State said Friday.
results.title: Mexico: State Officials Find 60 Bodies Inside an Abandoned Crematorium

results.body: Outrage over the presumed grisly slaying of 43 college students is the latest example of a breakdown of law and order in the country.

nytd_org: Escuela Normal Rural Raul Isidro Burgos (Guerrero, Mexico)

results.title: Law and Order in Mexico

results.body: A big, new resort might represent a reversal of Acapulco’s reputation as a drug-gang crime center.
results.title: Acapulco Tries a Rewind to Its Jet Set Days
